result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:29 AM Defendant Monika S Hegwood in court.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Monika S Hegwood.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status. 
Defense has received discovery and an offer. 
Negotiations are ongoing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:17 AM Defendant Monika S Hegwood in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Judge Carter is covering hearing for Judge Dorow. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives reading. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 

Atty Bonneson has received discovery and an offer, requests a status. Court sets.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:40 AM Defendant Monika S Hegwood appeared by Zoom with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson who appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  The State to file an information.  Attorney Bonneson is asking for an arraignment date before the Trial Court.  The Court will set this matter for arraignment before the Trial Court.  Arraignment scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
